Package Tools

Class FileResourcesUtils

java.lang.Object
Tools.FileResourcesUtils
public class FileResourcesUtils extends Object
This class supports IO fetch and usage. Due to the nature of a Maven project we save all the resources to the resources directory.
Author:
Michail Panagiotis Bofos, Demetra Hadjicosti, Ioanna Theofilou, Lucía Jiménez García

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Configuration
    getConfig​(String filename)
    This method gets the client or server configuration from a file located in the resources directory.
    InputStream
    getFileFromResourceAsStream​(String fileName)
    This method fetches a file from the resources directory (where all files, images etc should be saved).
    String
    getInputStream​(InputStream is)
    This method reads and returns ONLY the first line of a file Be careful, in this stage we only use this object and this function to get the configuration of the clients and the servers which means we only need a line for host IP and the port in use.

    This method prints a files' content.

      public Configuration getConfig​(String filename)
      This method gets the client or server configuration from a file located in the resources directory.
      Parameters:
      filename - String the name of the json file with the configuration
      Returns:
      Configuration object

    • getFileFromResourceAsStream

      public InputStream getFileFromResourceAsStream​(String fileName)
      This method fetches a file from the resources directory (where all files, images etc should be saved).
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file
      Returns:
      InputStream handler of the file

    • printInputStream

      public static void printInputStream​(InputStream is)
      This method print the content of a file using its inputStream handler.
      Parameters:
      is - InputStream handler of the file

    • getInputStream

      public String getInputStream​(InputStream is)
      This method reads and returns ONLY the first line of a file Be careful, in this stage we only use this object and this function to get the configuration of the clients and the servers which means we only need a line for host IP and the port in use. If you wish to extend the IO from files using this function, you could and should create a string with all the lines of the file in it. In any other case you should create a new function which fits your purpose better. UPDATE: Most probably this is resolved but if you intend to use this method I strongly recommend to try it thoroughly.
      Parameters:
      is - InputStream the file handler
      Returns:
      the first line of the file

    • printFile

      public static void printFile​(File file)
      This method prints a files' content.
      Parameters:
      file - The name of the file we want to print its content
